sections.heading: What is Japanese Slang?
sections.content:
Japanese slang (俗語 zokugo or スラング surangu) includes informal words and expressions used in casual conversation, especially among young people. Slang changes quickly and varies by age group, region, and subculture.

Types of Japanese slang:

Youth slang (若者言葉 wakamono kotoba) Internet slang (ネットスラング netto surangu) Abbreviated forms (略語 ryakugo) Made-up expressions Trend-based phrases

Warning: Slang can sound rude or inappropriate in formal settings. Use only with close friends of similar age.

children.heading: やばい (yabai) - Most Versatile Slang
children.content:
Originally meant "dangerous" but now means almost anything based on context.

Positive uses:

このラーメン、やばい！ Kono ra-men, yabai! "This ramen is amazing!" やばい、かわいい！ Yabai, kawaii! "Oh my god, that's so cute!"

Negative uses:

やばい、財布忘れた！ Yabai, saifu wasureta! "Oh no, I forgot my wallet!" テスト、やばい。 Tesuto, yabai. "The test is terrible/I'm screwed."

Excitement:

やばっ！マジで！？ Yaba! Maji de!? "No way! Seriously!?"

children.heading: マジ (maji) - Seriously/Really
children.content:
Used for emphasis or to ask if something is true.

マジ？ Maji? "Seriously?" / "Really?" マジでやばい Maji de yabai "Seriously terrible/amazing" マジ最高！ Maji saikou! "Seriously the best!" マジか！ Maji ka! "Are you serious!?"

children.heading: ウケる (ukeru) - Funny/Hilarious
children.content:
Literally "to receive" but used for "that's funny."

超ウケる！ Chou ukeru! "That's hilarious!" ウケたー Uketa- "That was funny" マジウケる Maji ukeru "That's seriously funny"

children.heading: キモい (kimoi) - Gross/Creepy
children.content:
Contraction of 気持ち悪い (kimochi warui).

キモい虫！ Kimoi mushi! "Gross bug!" あいつキモい Aitsu kimoi "That guy's creepy"

children.heading: ダサい (dasai) - Uncool/Lame
children.content: その服ダサい Sono fuku dasai "Those clothes are lame" ダサっ Dasa "That's lame"

children.heading: エグい (egui) - Extreme/Intense
children.content:
Can be positive or negative depending on context.

エグいくらい辛い Egui kurai karai "Insanely spicy" エグい量 Egui ryou "Insane amount"

children.heading: 神 (kami) - God/Amazing
children.content:
Used to praise something as godlike.

この曲、神！ Kono kyoku, kami! "This song is godly!" 神対応 Kami taiou "Godly customer service" 神回 Kami-kai "God-tier episode"

children.heading: エモい (emoi) - Emotional/Touching
children.content:
From "emotional" - describes something that touches your heart.

この写真エモい Kono shashin emoi "This photo is so nostalgic/touching" エモい曲 Emoi kyoku "Emotional song"

children.heading: あざす (azasu) / あざっす (azassu)
children.content:
Casual "thanks" from ありがとうございます.

あざす！ Azasu! "Thanks!" まじあざ Maji aza "Thanks so much!"

children.heading: り (ri) / りょ (ryo)
children.content:
Super casual "OK/Roger" from 了解 (ryoukai).

り！ Ri! "Got it!" りょ Ryo "OK!" りょーかい Ryo-kai "Roger that!"

children.heading: ワンチャン (wan chan)
children.content:
"One chance" - maybe, possibly.

ワンチャンいける Wan chan ikeru "Maybe I can do it / There's a chance" ワンチャン間に合う Wan chan maniau "Might make it in time"

children.heading: バズる (bazuru)
children.content:
To go viral (from "buzz").

バズった Bazutta "It went viral" バズってる Bazutteru "It's going viral"

children.heading: ウザい (uzai) - Annoying
children.content:
Short for うるさい (urusai).

ウザい奴 Uzai yatsu "Annoying person" 超ウザい Chou uzai "Super annoying"

children.heading: ムカつく (mukatsuku) - Irritating
children.content:
Feeling irritated or angry.

マジでムカつく Maji de mukatsuku "That really pisses me off" ムカつく！ Mukatsuku! "That's irritating!"

children.heading: ディスる (disuru)
children.content:
To diss/insult someone.

友達をディスる Tomodachi wo disuru "Diss a friend" ディスられた Disurareta "I got dissed"

children.heading: 終わった (owatta) - It's Over/Screwed
children.content:
Originally "finished" but used for being screwed.

もう終わった Mou owatta "I'm done for / It's over" 人生終わった Jinsei owatta "My life is over" (dramatic)

children.heading: 無理 (muri) - Impossible/Can't Even
children.content:
Used to express something is impossible or you can't handle it.

無理無理無理！ Muri muri muri! "No way no way no way!" もう無理 Mou muri "I can't anymore / I'm done"

children.heading: Common Abbreviations
children.content: スタバ (sutaba) ← スターバックス (Starbucks) マック (makku) ← マクドナルド (McDonald's) コンビニ (konbini) ← コンビニエンスストア (convenience store) リア充 (riajuu) ← リアル充実 (fulfilled in real life) KY (ke-wai) ← 空気読めない (can't read the air/clueless) JK (jee-kee) ← 女子高生 (high school girl) DK (dee-kee) ← 男子高生 (high school boy)

children.heading: お疲れ様 Variations
children.content: お疲れ様です → おつかれさま → おつ → おつー Otsu "Good work" / "Thanks for your effort" おつかれー Otsukare- "Cheers" (casual)

children.heading: ありがとう Variations
children.content: ありがとうございます → ありがとう → あざす → あざっす → あざ Aza "Thanks" サンキュー → さんきゅ → 39 (san-kyuu)

children.heading: Emoticon-Based
children.content: www (warau warau warau) "lol" - laughing (like "hahaha") 草 (kusa) - "grass" (looks like www) "lol" 大草原 (dai sougen) "huge grassland" - LOLOLOL

children.heading: Number-Based
children.content: よろしく (yoroshiku) → 4649 4 (yo), 6 (ro), 4 (shi), 9 (ku) ありがとう (arigatou) → 39 3 (san), 9 (kyuu) → thank you

children.heading: Katakana Shorthand
children.content: 乙 (otsu) ← お疲れ様 "Good work" うp (upu) ← アップロード "Upload" ktkr ← きたこれ (kita kore) "It's here! / Yes!"

children.heading: Modern Internet Slang
children.content: 推し (oshi) - Your favorite (idol, character, etc.) "My favorite" 沼 (numa) - "Swamp" - being obsessed with something "I'm obsessed" 尊い (toutoi) - "Precious/sacred" - something so good it's precious "So precious!" 〜み (～mi) - Adding "ness" to words つらみ (tsurami) - from つらい (painful) = "painfulness" わかりみ (wakarimi) - from 分かる (understand) = "understandability"

children.heading: 2020s Popular Slang
children.content: ぴえん (pien) - Sad crying emoji sound "I'm sad" ぱおん (paon) - More intense version of ぴえん "I'm really sad" それな (sore na) - "That's right" / "Exactly" Agreement わかりみが深い (wakarimi ga fukai) "I deeply understand" / "So relatable" エモすぎる (emo-sugiru) "Too emotional/nostalgic" ガチ (gachi) - Serious/for real Short for ガチンコ (gachinko)

children.heading: Describing People
children.content: 陽キャ (you-kya) - Extrovert/popular person From 陽気なキャラクター 陰キャ (in-kya) - Introvert/quiet person From 陰気なキャラクター イケメン (ikemen) - Good-looking guy From いけてる (cool) + メン (men) 美人 (bijin) - Beautiful woman Standard word but commonly used 可愛い (kawaii) - Cute (universal)

children.heading: More Masculine
children.content: やべー (yabe-) - Instead of やばい マジっすか (maji ssu ka) - "Seriously?" 〜っす (ssu) - Casual です ending ウゼー (uze-) - Instead of ウザい

children.heading: More Feminine
children.content: かわいー (kawai-) - Cuuute! やだー (yada-) - Noo! / I don't want to! マジでー？ (maji de-?) - Reallyy? 〜じゃん (jan) - Sentence ending (though used by all)

children.heading: High School/University
children.content: チャリ (chari) - Bicycle テンション上がる (tenshon agaru) - Get excited ノリ (nori) - Vibe/energy/going with the flow

children.heading: Young Adults (20s-30s)
children.content: 映える (baeru) - Instagram-worthy インスタ映え (insuta-bae) - "Instagrammable" 意識高い系 (ishiki takai-kei) - Try-hard/wannabe sophisticated

children.heading: Too Rough/Rude
children.content:
クソ (kuso) - Shit (very vulgar) てめー (teme-) - You (hostile) うるせー (uruse-) - Shut up (rude) 死ね (shine) - Die (extremely rude)

Never use these unless you understand the severe social consequences.

sections.heading: Context Matters
sections.content:
The same slang can be friendly or offensive based on context:

ばか (baka) - Idiot/Stupid

Friendly: ばか！そんなことないよ！ "Silly! That's not true!" Offensive: お前ばかだな "You're an idiot"

sections.heading: Summary
sections.content:
Essential Slang to Know:

やばい - Amazing/terrible (most versatile) マジ - Seriously/really ウケる - Funny り/りょ - OK/got it 無理 - Can't/impossible www / 草 - lol

Key Points:

Slang changes quickly - stay updated through media Use only with friends of similar age Never use in business or formal settings Be careful with rough/rude slang Context determines if slang is appropriate Understand before using to avoid offense
